comment: Just took her for a 4-week summer course and don't regret it. Lots of work and assignments but worth it in the end getting a hard class out of the way. She was great, reviews projects before they're due for helpful feedback. If you don't slack and get lazy- it'll be an easy A/B. As long as you do your work I don't see how one could fail. Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Very knowledgeable, helpful, and responsive. The structure of the course were short quizzes, discussion posts, exams, and a group project/presentation. Attendance was taken randomly and there are a few class debates. I definitely recommend taking her, I feel like I learned so much!

Be prepared to learn a new chapter every week (2 days out of the week to learn a new chapter) if you don't fully get through it, you will have to teach yourself the material. This class moves very fast, so if you take a long time to learn new material, you will struggle. There are 3 exams, 6 projects, and 7 quizzes. Attendance happens at random.

Dr. Z is a good professor but this class is very difficult especially if you dont ask questions. She lets the S.I do the MAJOR review session which I personally don't think is as helpful as her doing the reviews herself! She is very helpful when it comes to projects (6), you can send her the project for help before you submit. Class moves very fast
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Difficult content, but great prof! She makes it simple to get a good grade. For projects, she gives feedback and provides cheat sheets for exams. She is very understanding and open to any questions. Attendance was taken randomly. Great prof for stats app.

I dont think I would have passed this class if I wouldve taken a different professor. I like that she would go over things multiple times if we didnt understand. She really does care about her students success and understanding the material

Great professor! I'm a bio major, & took this class as an extra to finish out my degree. Honestly, a pretty easy course. Lectures were very interesting, and loved the knowledge the professor had on each topic, very well spoken. Quite a handful of assignments but very doable. 2 exams given on lockdown browser online with a cheat sheet. 10/10

This is not an easy class, but she made it easy. She wants you to understand the material and will do whatever she can to ensure you succeed. She gives you lots of opportunities to get the highest grades on tests, quizzes, and projects. I would not have done well in this class without her.

Dr. Dianhan Zheng is an excellent professor of Industrial Organization Psychology. Her teaching approach is clear, engaging, and well-structured, making complex I/O concepts easy to understand. Dr. Zheng encourages critical thinking and real-world application, making the course insightful without being overwhelming. Highly recommended.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Dianhan Zheng is an excellent professor of Statistical Applications. Her clear and structured teaching style makes complex statistical concepts easier to understand. Dr. Zheng is approachable and always willing to help, offering insightful feedback. The course difficulty is moderate, with a balanced workload. I highly recommend this subject!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The class wasn't hard, but Dr. Zheng is very inconsiderate. I was in the hospital at the end of the semester and gave prior notice. She offered no sympathy, nor any extensions. All she did was tell me to withdraw, which was impossible, as the emergency withdrawal date had already passed. Her lack of empathy was upsetting and affected my GPA.

AMAZING!! Probably one of the best professors I've ever had, easy going and cares about her students. Weekly discussions/quizzes, 3 papers, and only a midterm and final. Participate and attend lectures helps to understand material better, and a short presentation that everyone has to do. Overall a great teacher and easy to talk to outside of class!

I absolutely loved Professor Zheng! Her lectures are always interesting and she gives a lot more context to the required material. The class does have a good amount of work but it is completely manageable and everything is very clear. She is understanding, kind, and funny. Not a harsh grader, just wants to see you put in effort. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Super good. I've already taken elementary stats and stats in high school so I had sort of a bottom level amount of knowledge for this course. She is absolutely amazing, she sets you up for success super good so even if you aren't too sure, you dont need to be. She will guide you, she makes it easy to get an A in all of her quizzes, projects, etc.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Zheng was very understanding when I had a family emergency. Attendance is mandatory and done randomly throughout the semester. I missed 3 classes in the whole semester, yet was unlucky that she was taking attendance on 2 of those days. I got a 6/10 on my attendance grade and got a B+ in the class as a result. Other than that, she is great!

Lectures were so pointless and unorganized. I swear I didn't learn a thing but managed to get an A. Whatever I did need to learn, I taught myself. All projects, quizzes, homework and tests were done online so showing up to class was so pointless

Since this was a hybrid-class, the instructor specified on the online course more than in person, making the in-person feel like a waste of time. All projects, tests, quizzes, finals are offered online. It was such a waste of time coming to class for a 50-minute lecture just for her to read off the PowerPoint that's already provided.

Dr. Zheng is an amazing professor. She does give a lot of homework out, but it is all to prepare you for the exams. I personally had to take this class three times, just to pass, but the third try was the charm. Six projects, quizzes, mindtap which is the homework, and three exams. The projects do weigh more than the three exams which helps grading
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Zheng was very nice and was always available if you needed help or anything. She is very understanding, but there is a lot of course work. Would definitely recommend taking her!

if you aren't good at math, this class is hard, new chapter every week, and with mindtap homework and 6 projects over the semester (which you are allowed to send to her early to check), along with unit quizzes, it is a lot of work. gives "cheat sheets" for tests with all formulas so we aren't forced to remember them, but lots of information overall
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Zheng was an extremely tough grader. You have a quiz and a discussion post due each week, the quizzes are usually 3-5 questions so if you miss more than 2 questions you fail. She tends to read straight from the powerpoint and sometimes the powerpoints on D2L are different than the ones she uses in class so it is hard to follow along.

This teachers gives so much work! Six projects, mintap quizzes due every week, quizzes due almost every week and random tests. You have no choice but to spend way more time doing stuff for this class than your other classes and its so easy to get behind because again, ITS SO MANY ASSIGNMENTS! My whole class this semester is struggling!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: 4 week class I recommend taking this class with a STAT class. This class is a lot of work but if you do the work and ask questions you can pass! You can send your projects  before the deadline fire feedback. Extra credit, study guide, and you can take quiz 3 times. Exams are locked. Most hand calculations can be performed on TI-84.  Google how!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Loved having Dr. Zheng I took a four-week course so the courseload was heavy but not too much. She was super great and actually got the class to participate in lectures. I'll absolutely be taking a course if she's the prof again. She was incredible and responsive outside of class as well. Absolutely recommend!

Professor Zheng is very nice and will always help you but this course can be tedious. There is a lot of unorganized work, attendance, and long lectures. The discussions take at least an hour each and includes a mandatory textbook. The class is okay but do not expect it to be laid back. You will learn a lot if you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures and power points are more than enough to comprehend the material. She is very caring and nice, lets you send her assignments for review before submitting them for a grade, and tells you what to fix. Homework is easy and you have 3 attempts on quizzes, you do have to come to class. Just pay attention in class and you will get an A.

Prof Zheng is a great professor. Yes it is a lot of work if you do work full time, however it's all about balance. As long as you pay attention and do what she asks, you'll do fine. I was concerned about my grade and she allowed me to do extra credit to bring my grade up. She's super helpful and understanding, you just have to try!

Prof. Zheng is very monotone, so good luck keeping your eyes open. If you work full time and go to school, don't take class with her. It was difficult juggling it all because her attendance is mandatory, class participation activities, and the wonderful group project. I absolutely loved the content but wouldn't recommend her as a prof.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: She is a great professor. She really cares about the class and knows the material well. Shes great a teaching and is always there to help. There is a lot of work and a lot of reading but if you pay attention to her lectures, youll pass the class.

If you read the textbook and listen to lectures the class will be easy. The projects are a little challenging, however, the professor will answer any questions and help you. You can retake the quizzes so it is easy to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One thing I loved about professor Zheng is that you could send her your projects for feedback before submitting them for a grade; which was incredibly helpful! But this class is homework HEAVY, quiz HEAVY, project HEAVY, test HEAVY... i don't think I've ever had a class with so many assignments! one of the toughest classes I've ever taken
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: She's very monotone which makes her lectures very boring, but the content is interesting.

I took Professor Zheng for I/O Psyc. Overall, her class was pretty easy. We had participation and attendance points, so attendance was mandatory. There's only two tests that are not that hard. Every week there was an easy discussion board post, and throughout the semester there were about 4 homework assignments and a group project (didn't like GP).
